website_summaries.verdict: Affordable goggles designed to fit over glasses.
pros: Though these goggles are cheap, they hold up well in rough conditions and fit over smaller glasses
cons: These goggles don't fit comfortably over larger glasses

customer_reviews.title: Better than my friends’ Oakleys!
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed by these goggles! I just went skiing in Vermont on one of the coldest days of the year and my friends-who all had Oakley or other more expensive goggles-had problems with extreme fogging or even icing over of their goggles. Mine were crystal clear the whole time and not foggy at all! Also I was worried about the blue reflective lens casting a weird blue color over everything but the color from the inside is pretty much no different from the real world! Recommended to my friends and would 100% recommend to anyone looking for a good deal that is worth it. Also they look super cool which is an added bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fit
customer_reviews.text: Fits comfortably and I also like that I can wear my regular prescription glasses underneath these Over-the-Glasses (OTG) ski goggles. OTG goggles are designed with a deeper lens well than regular ski goggles so that the goggles don't press my prescription glasses into my face. Now I don't have to spend a fortune on getting special prescription inserts that would be typically needed to fit inside standard ski goggles. I like these goggles!
customer_reviews.author: PrimeFan

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with these
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my ski trip to Wyoming. Everyone on the slopes had Smith's and Oakley's and I had a great pair at a fraction of the cost. I've never been skiing before and these worked great. If you don't mind the lack of a logo on the band and just want s good pair that hold up these are for you. Also, these do fit over glasses if you wear them. These also never fogged up once during my 6 day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Rashaad Smith

customer_reviews.title: These googles were amazing! We spent a week in Vail my husband ...
customer_reviews.text: These googles were amazing! We spent a week in Vail my husband and I both got a pair (he got the black) We went snow boarding, tubing, and took out snow mobiles. These goggles were perfect and I even got a few compliments on them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: They are all around amazing. Then you compare price to name brand goggles ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband used these goggles for snowboarding on a recent trip. They are all around amazing. Then you compare price to name brand goggles and these are definitely the way to go. *Great Price, Great Product.* The Black "VLT 8%" is the exact product he purchased. He would not recommend for night boarding, but during the day including overcast days they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect goggle for the beginner or the occasional skier
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up for myself after buying the youth versions for my kids for their first ski trip. I was really impressed. Worked perfectly. I've skid my entire life and had tons of different brands of goggles. These are not top of the line by any means, but they are the best goggle you can get at this price. Plus they do all the things you need a goggle to do. They are comfortable and the foam is soft on the skin. They have a good anti fog coating. The strap is easy to adjust. They have UV protection and clear visibility. These are the perfect goggles for beginners or the occasional skier.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and non fogging
customer_reviews.text: Used on a bike ride in 20F temps and 10 mph winds. Protected my eyes and face perfectly. I did stop about 3 miles into the rude due to fogging. Turns out my glasses fogged up and not the goggles. I wore a balaclava and had covered my mouth. This did push some breath up into the goggles and condensed on the glasses. Next time I will use anti fog treatment on my glasses to prevent this. Otherwise these worked very well in sunny conditions with snow.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: was super comfortable. On a scale from small to large
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality, never fogged, was super comfortable. On a scale from small to large, these are on the smaller side, but not uncomfortably so. They were flattering, lightweight, easy to wear/remove, and looked great! The polarity of 15% was great for both the whiteout conditions and the sunny day we had on our trip. They kept me warm when it got cold, and cool when it heated up. Definitely will buy again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Stardust

customer_reviews.title: Fits People with Glasses
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, I do not get paid to write reviews. I also did not receive this product for free in exchange for a good review. I haven’t used these much yet as it’s been unseasonably warm the last week in Wisconsin. Here’s the big advantages: first is that if you wear glasses, these will work. I have a large head and wear Oakley glasses (run a bit wider) and these goggles fit absolutely perfect on my face. I love the tint on these as it’s not too dark or too light and the reflective tint on the exterior looks classy. I can’t speak on the longevity, but I will update next winter.
customer_reviews.author: Wathan48

customer_reviews.title: Love! Fog free
customer_reviews.text: We have only had them 2 days but so far they have surpassed the cheaper junk I accidentally bought that these replaced. Fog free!! The kids love them for the comfort, eye protection and basic sassy look. They also fit my husband and myself so good to grow with. They have a sturdy feel and a basic “worth the price” feel to them. 2 days of sledding/snowboarding down and many more to come.
customer_reviews.author: Damion lea

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Took these to Aspen Colorado and they were amazing! Didn't fog and kept the sun glare away, glad I didn't spend a fortune on other pairs
customer_reviews.author: kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME!!! I wore these without glasses and had no problem at all. They held up great, didn't fog up, and really blocked the sun's rays. I wore these on both sunny and overcast/ blustery days while skiing in Snowbird. They're cool looking and made me look like I belonged on the mountain, I mean bunny slope ;) I really didn't want to spend a ton of money on goggles and these definitely did the job. I'm still learning how to ski as I'm a Florida native and just tried skiing for the first time 2 years ago (I'm in my mid-30s- eek!). I'm very pleased with this purchase. Excellent goggles!!!
customer_reviews.author: TMC

customer_reviews.title: These goggles are not good for skiing when it’s snowing
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are not good for skiing when it’s snowing! The foam on the top absorbs the snow and as it melts it drips down causing condensation inside of your goggles. I had to buy different goggles while in Breckenridge because of this. I would not recommend these if you plan on skiing while it’s snowing.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Barbas

customer_reviews.title: Great if you wear glasses
customer_reviews.text: I do wear glasses and I purchased these goggles specially for those wintery snow blizzards days in the Northeast when I'm shoveling the driveway/walkways. They are very comfortable while wearing my glasses however I should've purchased the goggles with a lighter tint for those cloudy days.
customer_reviews.author: B.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit w/ Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Coupled with a helmet, they fit snug and tight around the face without hitting the helmet. They breath well. After a stress test on the slopes we'll see how these hold up. So far they look and feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Manning

customer_reviews.title: Not OTG!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking but they are too small to go over my glasses! I have to return them :-(
customer_reviews.author: MStone

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: What I ordered is exactly what I got. I have a small face and it fits me perfectly. I've been searching for a snowboarding goggles for weeks that wasn't see through and isn't too expensive. The reflective mirror look is awesome! It's a great product for it's price. Would buy again in a different color. Quality is good too. I wish they made one in white frame and purple lens. Will be using it soon and will edit if the goggles fog up or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tight Fit Over The Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Nice goggles at a very good price but they did not fit very well over my glasses. My glasses are 5.5 inches wide and the foam pushed too hard on the glasses temple side stems. I sent these goggles back and then ordered the PRO model which fit OTG fine.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Player

customer_reviews.title: Not great for OTG
customer_reviews.text: So these are billed as OTG goggles, and while they do fit nicely over the glasses, they FOG YOUR GLASSES LIKE CRAZY!!! The materials feel really cheap too. I guess you get what you pay for, but the other reviews were so good that I'm pretty surprised. They work fine as regular goggles but not great as OTG.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Lee

customer_reviews.title: I really can't recommend this product for people that wear eye glasses because ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is esthetically pleasing but misses the mark. I really can't recommend this product for people that wear eye glasses because with heavy physical activity your glasses will fog. I removed the ventilation foam from the top and bottom in an effort to allow facial heat to escape...this was only marginally better. If it's a heavy wind day you might get better cross ventilation but for me that was not the case. I removed my hat to allow heat to escape from my head but my eye glasses stilled fogged. I actually don't feel any product of this nature which offers a full goggle fit will retard fog from forming your my eyeglass. Good luck in your search.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Boler

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Definitely for daytime use. Came with a nice drawstring bag for storage. Product requires care; must avoid scratching film on interior of lens. Described as anti fogging. I find there is still some fogging of lens during use. Features over the glasses design. In other words, goggles can be worn over glasses. That is true, but ... my glasses have smaller lenses with narrow frames. They do fit inside the goggles, but it is a somewhat snug fit, and the glasses stay in the goggles on removal. In addition, the glasses WILL scratch the film on the inside of the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: LeonaBelle

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Durable, Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Met a guy on the gondola, complimented him on his goggles, and he told me they were $20 and that he just keeps buying cheap goggles as he needs them. Said it ends up being cheaper than a $200 pair. Made sense to me so I found these. Honestly, I mostly bought them for the lens color (VLT 15%, blue). They fit me well. You might not like that the lens is glued in place, but then what do you expect for $20?
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyPTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value and great for night skiing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these goggles with the VLT 80% light green lens specifically to use for night skiing. They were delivered faster than expected. I have used them a number of times on cold nights. They fit well with my helmet and provide a clear and wide field of view. They are light, soft and comfortable and keep the wind out of my eyes and my face warm while not fogging up. They provide good contrast under night skiing conditions as you can see in the picture. I don’t wear glasses, so cannot comment on the OTG aspects of these goggles. Excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ski Guy

customer_reviews.title: Scratched upon arrival?!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. I received these today and the lens has numerous tiny scratches all over it. If they weren’t in the line of site then they could be usuable but some of the “cluster” scratches are in direct eye site. The packaging is also not meant to be shipped with multiple items. Looks like I have to do a rush order for my ski trip next week.
customer_reviews.author: ChickenRun

customer_reviews.title: I bought these based on all the good reviews. However
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on all the good reviews. However, I had the worst luck with them. They stayed foggy the whole time I was skiing and they came with scratches all over the lens part of the googles Needless to say, I was quite disappointed with this purchase and just bought a new pair, from a different brand, for my upcoming ski trip. I would definitely not recommend these unless you want an uphill battle with these goggles the whole time you are skiing/snowboarding.
customer_reviews.author: Edmonds Family

customer_reviews.title: Glasses fog up in the goggles
customer_reviews.text: Used for 2 snowboarding seasons wearing glasses. Fits my glasses somewhat. I have round shape glasses. My glasses fog up in the goggles might not have ventilation for people wearing glasses. My friend got the same pair and his glasses fog up too. Deciding if i should poke a hole in the foam to allow more ventilation
customer_reviews.author: alansunshine

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and smelly
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package, I was greeted by the distinct odor of under-cured foam. After a week in open air, the smell never diminished. The manufacturer clearly doesn't believe American consumers care about being exposed to toxic chemicals. The coating on these lenses are uneven, and you can see where some areas are thicker than others. I've returned these, and recommend that you avoid them if you care about your health. If you want a similar price point ski goggle that doesn't literally stink, look in my reviews for the Gonex polarized models.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Really decent goggles for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I've used these 3x this season to ski and for the 20$, they're actually really good goggles. They're totally mirrored out, and provide really decent light protection. They do have their flaws, (nothing too ridiculous) and the construction isn't elite tier, (make sure you keep them in the bag they will scratch up easy) and I'm going to upgrade to Oakley in the immediate future, but for what you pay for these, they're a REALLY solid cheap backup pair for those super bright days. *The most important thing for me was that I had very little to no fogging issues.* If you're on a budget and looking to shred the gnar, these goggles are the pair for you.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Martino

customer_reviews.title: All weather comfort, protection and visibility
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these googles for rain or cold. I use them over my glasses on our farm in bad weather. No more fogged up or rain covered glasses or freezing my face. Livestock need attention no matter the weather and these googles make that possible.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Pontius

customer_reviews.title: For Budget Goggles, These Are Pretty Nice
customer_reviews.text: My application is motorcycle riding not skiing, so my comments are based on this application. These look and feel great. The band is wide enough to hold them in place firmly with no tendency to flip over. The view is pretty clear and the reflective finish is very nice I do wear glasses and these fit over them, no problem they form well to my face and they look great, especially at this price. The bag helps me store them while reducing the chance to be scratched. my only critique would be that if you dislike foam directly on your face (2nd photo), look for another style
customer_reviews.author: R. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: A review for the person who doesn't know what goggles to buy
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased these goggles only because of the good reviews and review photos. But after receiving them, here's the truth. The packaging was perfect, comes with a little protection carrier bag. The goggles have a protective lining on the inside to protect item from scratches or damage in shipping process. After peeling the lining off and trying them on, the product fit PERFECT and if you are worried that they may look large on your face, they won't. Perfect size in my opinion. Goggles band is also comfortable and not too restricting. Adjustable band. If you are new to snowboarding/skiing, grab these. You wont regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Jake H.

customer_reviews.title: Broken Before First Use
customer_reviews.text: I live in Bush Alaska, where goggles are a necessity for being able to get somewhere and still be able to see. I bought these so I could walk to work when the wind blows snow at 35+ miles per hour. I needed them this morning, but when I pulled them from their storage place, the strap that connects to the actual mask was broken. I never even got to wear these!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: These goggles have given me a part of my life back.
customer_reviews.text: I am horribly light sensitive, to the point my eyes will fully dilate naturally. These googles just arrived today. I put them on and they felt super comfortable and not hot. I decide to try them outside, yes I wear them inside also but not the point. I walked over 2 miles and came home. The googles got a touch warm, well, because there's no snow around but, hey, you work with what works and these googles work. So far, this is the longest I have avoid severe migraine pain without being unconscious. Thank you Outdoor Master for giving me back a bit of my lost freedom and I will be buying at least one spare for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these goggles to go skiing and have only owned them for a little over a week and worn them once. So far, they fit great with my helmet and are very comfortable. They look great and the price point was very good for someone who would use them a few times a year. Only minor complaint, if I had to give one, is that these don't sit flush to your face if you have a slightly flatter face (i.e. Asian facial structure). I could see a little bit of sunlight peaking up from the nose bridge area but totally worth it for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: VTParadox

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Wash or Use Lens Cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: Interesting to see upon purchase/receiving, that the anti-fog material is protected by an adhesive clear wrap on the inside of the lens. Instructions specifically forbid cleaning the lens, both interior lens and exterior, but would imagine it is fine to clean the exterior side of the plastic lens with a plastic safe lens cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got these as spare goggles for ski patrol since goggles have a tendency to disappear after helping patients. The back plastic pieces had a small piece break off within a week, but I was transitioning them from beanie to helmet size pretty often. Was able to fix it with a bit of tape pretty easily and they still work fine. Decent lens on them, doesn't fog easily, and the field of vision is the same as my good Smiths. Would be great goggles for vacationers skiing a week or so a year.
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Super cool ski goggles!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like cool how these googles look when I have them on! I wore them for a whole day of skiing at Crystal Mountain, WA and I’m very happy with them: - Cushioning is good for the surrounding areas of your eye - Size is a little tight at the front if you have a face cover on. I tried to adjust the length and the back but never got it to fit perfectly - Sun protection is really good considering it was a very sunny day (no clouds). I hadn’t realized how good it was until I took them off outside and my eyes hurt when I was talking to my friend. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ValH

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I just moved to Colorado. We were experiencing our first ski season and wanted to get a cheaper pair of goggles for the few times we go to ski. When we went to the mountain, the weather was sunny, cloudy and lightly snowing on our ski day. These goggles were great! They did not fog up for my husband at all. My only fogged up with I had something over my mouth in which I was breathing heavily but it did not fog up completely where I couldn't see. I wo UK ld suggest these to anyone who is first time or goes a few times during the season.
customer_reviews.author: Pheonix

customer_reviews.title: They're great if you don't wear a "lid".
customer_reviews.text: These goggles don't have a long enough strap to fit comfortably with a helmet - they're TIGHT. Also, the buckle in the middle of the strap doesn't fit in the goggle strap retention device on most helmets. And they leave a bit of "gaper gap". Great goggles if you don't wear a "lid".
customer_reviews.author: MGD

customer_reviews.title: Great low-cost goggles... but chintzy strap almost a deal-breaker
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at the features you get for less than a third of what you'd typically pay for equivalent brand-name goggles. BUT, the strap, far from being "extra-long" as claimed in the product description, is just barely long enough to fit on my ordinary-sized helmet and ordinary-sized face. "Leftover" space between the two buckles = NONE. An inch shorter and I'd be sending them back. One more issue is the very strong, and very unpleasant, chemical smell from the plastic frame when I first opened the package (I hate to think what the factory floor must be like). However, 24 hours later it's much less noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: RF456

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for winter biking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for work commutes in the wonderfully sub-zero weather in Minnesota. I haven't had any issues with them fogging up (if anyone would, just buy some SEA DROPS, and you'll be all set. These goggles block out the intense reflection of the sun off of the snow, and I've even used them at night in the city without any difficulty seeing. If you're looking for something that is near air tight (allows airflow to prevent fogging, but does not allow drafts), and something that is durable, these are the goggles for you!
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Looks wise I am totally down because it makes me look like the Snake Eyes action figure from GI Joe in ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a little snug but I have a rather large head both physically and metaphorically. I use this for bike commuting, Bicycle, not Motor. Looks wise I am totally down because it makes me look like the Snake Eyes action figure from GI Joe in the 80s, a totally sweet ninja spy. It definitely keeps the cold off my eyes and prevents my glasses from fogging up for the most part. And I got 53% VLT lenses that function on the bike trail at night. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: marco athie

customer_reviews.title: Truly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on skiing or snowboarding you need this! I bought these to go skiing in Canada and these were amazing. I never got blinded by the sun and I always had a clear view of where I was going. When I fell down in the snow these helped me see clearly and they didn’t get foggy at all. I also got these for my sign other and he says the same thing worked amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: The goggles do fit as they should and look good otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars instead of 5 as the goggles didnt come with the carry bag and theres a small scratch on the lense. I ordered these from another vendor (with different lens) & the goggles came with the case and a soft cloth for cleaning. This pair just came in a plastic bag, no protection. The goggles do fit as they should and look good otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: These are GREAT goggles! I wore them for three days of ...
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT goggles! I wore them for three days of skiing and not once did I have any fogging trouble. They fit perfect over my glasses and with a helmet and the lens was good color for both bright sunny days as well as overcast. I can't say enough about theses I have used some very expansive goggles and these worked just as well if not better then them all.
customer_reviews.author: Brad152

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't the same as it was in the picture ...
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't the same as it was in the picture. In the pic, it was a pink strap and polarized lens of goggles but when I got it, its different.
customer_reviews.author: JLR

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value goggles
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 10% option, and you definitely need to know that these measurements are not misleading, this is fantastic for super sunny days on the slopes where you have sun from above and reflecting back from snow. They are okay in darker situations, but if you are skiing in dark conditions or maybe a strong snow storm i would recommend a higher % rating as this gets very dark very fast. My stopping point is the golden hour, just before the last bit of dusk these will become depressingly dark 🤣 but for the price they fit awesome, breathe well, headband is fully adjustable and comfortable, buy another shade if you want! I'm thinking about it 👌🏼
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Hack available
customer_reviews.text: I don't consider myself to have prominent cheek bones, so it must be that these goggles were designed for people with recessed cheek bones. These press really hard against my cheek bones and then tends to work it's way up my face. A simple design fix would be to provide angle adjustability to the strap or to have dual straps. Fortunately, there's a hack available. What I did was I took a pair or wire cutters and snipped all the tiny plastic supports that provide the spring tension between the frame and the cheek bone liner. Despite that issue, these goggles are an outstanding value and construction.
customer_reviews.author: Chester Chan

customer_reviews.title: It looks cool and fits well over my glasses
customer_reviews.text: It looks cool and fits well over my glasses. But the lens color is not even and is a little filmy. It got so foggy that I had to stop early from the slope - never happened to me Iike that even on the worst ski days with my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Lexgal

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for myself and my kids for a quick snowboarding trip, they are great goggles for the money. I am not sure how they will hold up over time compared to a more expensive brand, but for the price if they break or scratch you can just order another pair. The tint on them was just right for bright conditions and not to dark for snowing conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Gift Card

customer_reviews.title: Needed Over the Glasses and bought these for night skiing
customer_reviews.text: For the money these are a great value. Good quality although not the level of quality you would find in a pair costing 5 times as much. I bought these with clear lenses for night skiing, explaining my low rating for 'sun protection' - tinted lenses would rate higher. It's a little hard to find OTG goggles with clear lenses and for the price these met all of my requirements. Comfortable, fog resistant, look good. So far good scratch resistance. Come with a nice microfiber storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen S

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I've been debating if I should get these or not and I ended up getting 3 pairs. These goggles are AWESOME. I used them and my kids did too and we were all impressed with the quality, durability and fit of these. For me they had somewhat better performance when there was some sun versus overcast as that the goggles were making it too dark for me but even with that I am in love with these. Great product. I would definitely recommend it and buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy A

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: These were fine on a cloudy and mild day and for night skiing. I actually only bought these goggles for sunny conditions because my other nicer Smith goggles have a scratch on them and then get bad glares in the sun. However, I had a day were it was like 10 degrees fahrenheit & snowing quite a lot and they did end up getting foggy, so I took them briefly off to eventually wipe the fog off, but the insides of the goggles immediately froze over. So, these aren’t great for very cold or wet conditions. However, I will say the person I was with had Smith goggles and he was having fogging issues as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cami L. Morrill

customer_reviews.title: OGG fit & quality
customer_reviews.text: Received the goggles in only 2 days! I needed a clear lens for snow blowering at night. I bought a sun lens google different vendor a few months ago. The Out Door Master googles give me better clearance over my bi-focal glasses, but the overall outer size is actually smaller than the other brand. Making them look sleek. I could put my clip on sun glasses with these. The lens is fitted and sealed very well to the body of the google. The strap is very adjustable and well made. I have been skiing & snowboarding for many years, these are one of the finest googles I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price - Biker
customer_reviews.text: I ride a bike each morning in the DC area back and forth to work. Without these glasses my eyes teared all the time. With these, the ride is much nicer. I got the 80% vlt since I ride early in the am, and it's pretty dark. Visibility is great. It usually doesn't fog unless I stop to wait for a light to change while I am sweating a little.
customer_reviews.author: lovemath

customer_reviews.title: Anti-fogging nonexistent
customer_reviews.text: Went snowboarding with these this past weekend, and couldn't do more than 2 runs before these started fogging up. Severely hindered my riding for the entire weekend. I'm extremely dissatisfied with these.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: These worked well for me. I would buy them again if needed. I bought two pair of ski goggles with different VLT's because it was cheaper to go that route then buy one with two different lenses. I cannot testify to durability other than they held up fine for one day of snowboarding. I will warn you though, they scratch very easily. Do Not wipe the lenses with anything other than a cloth designed for that purpose. Mine came with a cloth bag to store it in and it doubles for wiping the lens. That works with out scratching the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must buy before ski trip! same quality as 200.00 pairs.
customer_reviews.text: man i'm glad i bought these before i went to tahoe, ones similar to this were at least 100 but most were 200+. My friends bought name brand for 100 while there and they werent nearly as good as these. i would compare mine to the 200.00 pairs we tried on at the ski shops. these googles have the same nice soft felt lining as the expensive pairs, worked great for me and didnt ever fog up or scratch up during the many wipeouts i had.
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: was disappointed. The frame is fixed size and shape
customer_reviews.text: Correction - I find I can put my glasses into the goggle first, then it fits! 5 star! I bought the goggles under the impression that they can fit over my prescription glasses, was disappointed. The frame is fixed size and shape. While the advertisement mentions fitting men, women and kids, it is aiming for the median size. I can imagine a young child can wear this with glasses on. For my face, the width is on the narrow side, the curvature is too high (leaves a gap at the nose bridge), and there is absolutely no room for glasses. The qualify looks fine, worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jian

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift for Christmas but my husband was going to go out and buy some because we got an early snow. I decided to gift them to him early and he used them immediately and really likes them a lot; says they're perfect. He needed goggles to fit comfortably over his glasses as well as under his face cover for serious cold weather. These really seem to be just what he wanted. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Cam2

customer_reviews.title: Actually "Much" Better than Described
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Actually much better than described. Incredible value. Easily fit over my glasses. Super comfortable. Excellent lens with the just the right amount of sun screening. Far superior to my Oakleys which cost 5x as much. I'm an avid skier and as I stood in the lift line this past weekend I was surprised to see quite a few people were wearing Outdoor Master goggles. The secret is apparently out.
customer_reviews.author: Dadhertz

customer_reviews.title: Buy it and you won't regret!
customer_reviews.text: Went skiing with a 20 degree temperature, stormy, and low visibility condition. This goggle was one of the best thing I ordered! I ordered the black TOG one and wore it on top of my prescription glasses. My family kept complimenting my goggle and wanted to have one for their own. I'm going to order for them in the future. This is an honest review.
customer_reviews.author: AmazYal

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke first time putting them on.
customer_reviews.text: Strap broke first time I tried to put them on, the day they arrived. Bought two sets and one is fine but the other wasn’t sewn well or something because it came apart the first time I tried to put them on. Unusable. The strap no longer attaches to the goggles. Also, for OTG goggles, they are not as comfortable or well fitting as other brands. May be fine for smaller framed glasses than what I have.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie K.

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Product did not fit plastic framed prescription glasses, only fits over an older smaller pair that i have. They should have max. measurement details listed in description. Also came in a different color than what I ordered. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great without glasses 🤓
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are great for the price. I took off 1 star because they are advertised to be for people with glasses. When I tried them with glasses the glasses underneath fogged up. Without the glasses these inexpensive goggles rock!!
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck, beware the lense color choice though.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price, fits perfectly over my glasses and the reflective coating on the lenses looks great. I will say the lens color is obnoxious for skiing as it's yellow at the top and rose at the bottom leaving your eyes constantly adjusting. I'd rather it be the other way around at least then you could see the ground with less obstruction. I will say they are comfortable and a great price, buying another pair in a solid color with less tint for darker days and afternoons.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Survived Arctic Weather
customer_reviews.text: moved from Arizona to North Pole Alaska recently - bought handfuls of arctic gear for different purposes, not knowing what cold was really like. first week in the new house it was -45 below. I spent 3 hours one day clearing snow off back deck, snowblowing driveway, etc. and these worked amazing. cant wait to use when I get my new snowmobile ( or snowmachine as they say here in Alaska)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Goggles
customer_reviews.text: I needed to pick up new goggles for a ski trip to Colorado, and I ordered these last minute. Compared to the price of higher quality goggles, these are well worth the purchase. When worn with a helmet, they did seem to be a little too tall, causing the helmet to push them lower on my face, but it wasn't a deal breaker for me. I live on the east coast, and only ski a couple times a year, more regular skiers should probably invest in something better. For a casual skier like me, I think these are a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Do not use for skiing
customer_reviews.text: These goggles did not improve visibility while skiing. It leaves a dark blue tint and actually makes it more difficult to see texture and the terrain while on the mountain. Do not let the high rating fool you, they will not work as skiing goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Armen Petrossian

customer_reviews.title: Fits well over glasses with minimal fogging.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for outdoor work at the south pole with excellent results. When combined with a Seirus Original Masque, it provides nearly 100% skin coverage. Ventillation is just right. My glasses never fogged up with this combination. It was both comfortable and secure enough for all-day usage at -40 degrees. The darkest tint was perfect for snow-covered terrain under bright sunshine.
customer_reviews.author: Goo

customer_reviews.title: Scratches easily
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Great company to work with, they sent me a new pair since the last ones scratched so easily. Hopefully these will last longer // I bought these for my boyfriend for his first time skiing. He really liked them but wanted to make sure I mentioned that they didn't last one day of falls without getting a scratch on the anti-fog film inside. I had a different brand and they didn't have that weird film on the inside and worked out just fine. At least they were cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price but needs non-slip lining
customer_reviews.text: Stylish and fit well, but your glasses need to be pretty small if you use them. I still had some fogging issues due to fit. My biggest issue was the lack of rubber/non-slip lining on the underside of the strap. The other three brands my family wore had them, as did everything I looked at in stores. The goggles tend to slip up a bit if you're wearing a helmet. With just a knit cap, they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Goggles and sunglasses get scratched easily so why pay tons of money for expensive goggles, unless you are into buying "name brand" stuff. These do not fog easily and just saved my eyes yesterday from falling ice while I was out for a ride on the atv. When these get to scratched up for my liking i will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Albright

customer_reviews.title: These are great if you have a tiny head
customer_reviews.text: These Ski Goggles are described as OTG - Over the Glasses. They don't fit my head without my glasses, let alone with them. I even had my wife measure my head, it was in the "average" range. They seem more like a child's size pair of goggles than for a full size adult.
customer_reviews.author: Ezrway

customer_reviews.title: Use this as PPE during this Crisis
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I wear these googles when I go grocery shopping at Costco. This, a N95 mask (bought it 3 years ago to paint my house), gloves, and a hat. It's a selfish thing to do not wearing a mask while shopping at Costco. Glad they kick them out.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Fogs to easy.  Makes for a dangerous trip down slopes
customer_reviews.text: You want to be able to see while going down hill . Well these things fog up way to much , inhibiting your field of view. It’s dangerous. I can’t tecommend them.
customer_reviews.author: DiamondsForever

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good. I just bought these as a cheap solution to my girlfriend not having goggles. I was a bit bummed to see my low end Spys and my friend's low end Smiths being out performed by these goggles. She probably had the driest face and cleanest lenses throughout the whole day. And it wasn't a bluebird day. It was a kind of terrible storm day at Bear Mountain. I wouldn't mind picking up another pair for me, but probably not with white frames and pink lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: Good non fogging, comfortable over the glasses googles.
customer_reviews.text: Nice fitting, comfortable and non fogging. I have worn these when cross country skiing this winter in temps for 5 to 15 in sunny and cloudy conditions. No fogging up at all even when huffing up hills. No eye tearing from the wind any more and the top of the nose is even covered. Works great over my glasses and the nice wide head band is really comfy. Hope to get a second pair for really overcast days but the sunny pair I have are good even in overcast conditions.
customer_reviews.author: FGR

customer_reviews.title: My daughter love the appearance. (Fair)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this goggles for my daughter. When she first saw this goggles, the appearance is really nice, she loved it very much. Then we went to ski in Brianhead, Utah. My daughter complained that the goggles can’t protect her eyes from extreme bright sunlight while she was skiing. But the goggles is still comfortable and the anti-fog function is good too. That’s why I only gave three stars on the review based on what my daughter told me.
customer_reviews.author: TSZ KEUNG NG

customer_reviews.title: Love the goggles
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my snowboarding trip because I lost my other pair. I didnt want to buy very expensive goggles so I went with these and glad I did. Great for a sunny day protects your eyes. Sucks when your snowboarding at night because it hard to see. Overall I would recommend these. If you plan on going day and night snowboarding or skiing I would suggest buying a pair of Clear goggle for nights
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage and fitment, also good sun protection, still a little foggy at times
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are a little bulky but it's not heavy which is good. The protection again sun UV is good, didn't glare at all throughout sunny day. Easy to adjust fitment and it fits comfortable throughout the day. The only downside is at times it still fogs up a little bit, especially when walking around (when skiing it doesn't fog up which is good). Overall for the money I think it's a pretty decent deal!
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great price - good gear
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly on a 20°f clear skies day of skiing! I wear a lg-xl helmet / hat and sometimes have trouble with nose bridge fit/tightness, however, these goggles fit snug, but comfortable for hours in the cold. I am 55 so I went with the green tint 98% light transmission but only had an issue while facing the sun directly - and I was still able to see terrain/transitions after the afternoon shadows formed. I did trim the foam edges at the nose bridge slightly (1/8”) but that was the only modification needed. Very happy, could’ve easily spent a lot more!
customer_reviews.author: Rod Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it...
customer_reviews.text: No need to spend lots of money on goggles that are quite nice. My boy said they were very comfortable and never fogged up. We didn't night ski, but they didn't affect his vision as it became twilight. He said they certainly toned the sun down during the day. You just can't ski without goggles. Thank goodness you don't have to spend an arm and a leg for good ones.
customer_reviews.author: Thinny J

customer_reviews.title: Distorted Vision-Poor quality lenses
customer_reviews.text: Pretty to look at but the lenses are such a poor quality that everything is distorted and not good to wear. .
customer_reviews.author: BARBARA LAMBERT

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners, but will get upgraded quickly
customer_reviews.text: These are great for a trip to try out winter sports but you will want something else if you decide to ski or snowboard on a regular basis. It was a really bright day when I wore these and I needed to wear sunglasses under them to be comfortable. They would probably work well on an overcast day though. I wear prescription glasses and these fit over them quite well. I did not notice any discomfort while wearing these goggle and my eyeglasses. All in all this was a solid purchase. I wanted something inexpensive for a ski trip and these worked great for that. But as I started skiing more I wanted to upgrade these pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Len Mahaffey

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to Utah and worn them twice while snowboarding and once out snowmobiling. They only fogged up once on the first day, but I was taking a lot of falls which probably had something to do with it. I only wore them for maybe 2 hours. The next time out snowboarding wore them for 6+ hours and no issues and also none while snowmobiling. Great value
customer_reviews.author: brigitte

customer_reviews.title: Fits better over smaller glasses
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to wear over my prescription glasses while snow blowing in strong winds. They will fit over glasses depending on the size of the frames. One pair of my glasses these press too much on the frames, an older slightly smaller pair of glasses fit well under these googles. For the price worth a try to see if will work over your prescription glasses.
customer_reviews.author: NKC, MO

customer_reviews.title: Superb for snow-blowing!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying two of these as they are PERFECT to wear when I must venture outside and clear our long driveway of snow. It keeps that cold snow spray off my eyes while the tinted lenses negate the blinding light off the snow on the path. I don't use them for skiing, LOL, but WOW, are they the perfect solution to the dreaded but necessary evil of snow blowing!
customer_reviews.author: Bewilderedatman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, sleek, fit well
customer_reviews.text: I'll preface this by saying I've never used or owned expensive ski goggles, but seriously how much more do you need? They are sturdy enough to survive multiple suitcase trips. My husband and I both have a pair and they fit both of us well. Mine are 2 years old and still look new. I do keep them in the little bag they come in. Great value for the budget conscious.
customer_reviews.author: K Ming

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting ski googles- highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love, Love, Love these googles. Ski gear is so expensive and I had to purchase for 4 of us for a ski trip last week in Colorado. I highly recommend these googles. They fit perfect and they were so comfortable. Some of my family complained that their ski googles fogged up, but not these.
customer_reviews.author: brooksgina1

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable over prescription glasses
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because another similarly priced pair I purchased did not fit comfortably over my glasses. These are much better. They do not press my glasses against my face like others did. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Koz

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Snowboarding!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THEM!! Why spend $200 on snow goggles when you can buy these?! I wore them all day snowboarding and not only did i look legit, they were super comfortable and i didn’t want to take them off! They’re very lightweight and the sun protection is good. MUST have for the mountain!
customer_reviews.author: ALEXXAJE

customer_reviews.title: Great Cheap Goggles
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these a couple times for snowmobiling now and they are a great value for the money. They didn't fog at all on my last trip out, and were pretty good on my first trip with them, too. My only complaint is that the foam on the sides is a bit thin and allows some cold air through, so on colder days they aren't as comfortable. As a back-up google they are a great price/quality combo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ski goggle use
customer_reviews.text: I am not a skier, but wanted these to use for when I am undertaking snow removal, and the wind is brutal. These have helped provide vision when either using the snowblower, or roof raking. I can see the traffic coming now. the only issue in using these goggles are they are a bit tough on the nose. I seem to have a wide nose, thus a bit sore after 2-3 hours wear. Otherwise, a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D

customer_reviews.title: Works fine~ remember to remove the protective wrap on the inside of the goggle before use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it at the end of ski season back in 2018, so I did not try it on until this ski season. The first few times I tried it on, I forgot to remove the protective wrap on the inside of the goggle. Thus, everything looks blurry when I see through the goggle. After I removed it, everything looks great and work well. I wish there is a more clear label on the side that tells people to remove the wrapping before use.
customer_reviews.author: iDOBBi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid ski goggles for a value price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife for our first ski trip together. It was cheaper to buy these than rent gear at the lodge. These goggles are very comfortable and provide adequate protection from the elements. They're not polarized or anything fancy but they do the job. If you look directly at the sun you'll still burn out your retinas... so don't do that. Solid purchase for beginner skiiers!
customer_reviews.author: Dave D.

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: They scratched really easy and while they did fit over my glasses I quickly realized my glasses were not very fog resistant. That in itself is not a knock on the goggles because they did their job, but if you are buying them with the intent of wearing over your glasses make sure you get some type of anti fog coating. I ended up getting some cheap lens wipes that are supposed to apply an anti-fog coating and that worked for about 2-3 hours before I would need to reapply. Definitely not built to last multiples seasons, but good value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine had some that were $60 and these were no different if you ask me. They are comfortable and feel like they will last a while. I was able to see very well in the snow and it was really bright that day so the reflection of the sun was really bright. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: FIT WARNING: Nose piece is high/bowed forward
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! The goggles appear to be of great quality and I was so excited to receive them! Unfortunately, they're curved/bowed a lot more than expected, and the nose piece is positioned rather far forward/high. As a result, there is a gap between the goggles and the bridge of my nose--wide enough to stick my finger through with no problem--when I put them on. There's no way my face will stay warm or the goggles won't fog if they don't fit snugly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for night skiing or foggy day
customer_reviews.text: I boguht this to have an extra pair when it's cloudy, foggy. They worked great. I could use them even with a light sun, and the biggest concern I had was that I was going to carry around two pairs if the day was shifting. Of course, the clear lenses should not be used in full sun or even in a sunny day, you need yellow or red for that, at least. But these are great for night skiing and foggy day.
customer_reviews.author: Giacomo Bossa

product_meta.title: OutdoorMaster OTG Ski Goggles - Over Glasses Ski/Snowboard Goggles for Men, Women & Youth - 100% UV Protection
feature_bullets: OTG (OVER-THE-GLASSES) DESIGN - Ski goggles that fits over glasses. Suitable for both ADULTS AND YOUTH.
ANTI-FOG LENS & EXCELLENT OPTICAL CLARITY - Dual-layer lens technology with anti-fog coated inner lens gives you a FOG-FREE SKI EXPERIENCE.
SAFE & RELIABLE WITH UV PROTECTION - Soft TPU frame with lenses that provide 100% UV400 protection and YEARS OF RELIABLE USE.
UNIVERSAL HELMET COMPATIBILITY - Extra long elastic strap ensures great helmet compatibility with all helmets. Suitable for both adults & teens.
WHAT YOU GET: 1 x OutdoorMaster OTG Ski Goggles, 1 x Carrying Pouch, CUSTOMER-FAVORITE 1 YEAR WARRANTY and friendly customer service.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
